Corellon's Grace.name: Corellon's Grace
Corellon's Grace.flavor: Corellon's grace allows you to move when others take action.
Corellon's Grace.trigger: A creature within 10 squares of you spends an action point to take an extra action.
Corellon's Grace.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Armor of Bahamut.name: Armor of Bahamut
Armor of Bahamut.flavor: Bahamut protects you or a friend from devastating harm.
Armor of Bahamut.trigger: An enemy scores a critical hit against you or an ally within 5 squares of you.
Armor of Bahamut.effect: The critical hit becomes a normal hit.
Armor of Bahamut.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Avandra’s Rescue.name: Avandra’s Rescue
Avandra’s Rescue.flavor: Avandra smiles upon you and helps you rescue a friend in need.
Avandra’s Rescue.target: One ally who is the same size as you
Avandra’s Rescue.effect: You and the target each shift 1 square as a free action, swapping positions.
Avandra’s Rescue.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter

Harmony of Erathis.name: Harmony of Erathis
Harmony of Erathis.flavor: Erathis brings harmony of purpose to like-minded allies.
Harmony of Erathis.effect: The target gains a +2 power bonus to the first attack roll he or she makes before the start of your next turn.
Harmony of Erathis.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Ioun's Poise.name: Ioun's Poise
Ioun's Poise.flavor: Ioun grants strength of will to those she favors.
Ioun's Poise.effect: The target gains a +5 power bonus to Will until the start of your next turn.
Ioun's Poise.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Kord’s Favor.name: Kord’s Favor
Kord’s Favor.flavor: Kord favors a strong hit in combat with healing.
Kord’s Favor.trigger: You or an ally within 5 squares of you scores a critical hit with a melee attack.
Kord’s Favor.effect: The target can spend a healing surge.
Kord’s Favor.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Melora’s Tide.name: Melora’s Tide
Melora’s Tide.flavor: Melora sends a tide of healing energy to aid you or a bloodied friend.
Melora’s Tide.target: You or one ally (the target must be bloodied)
Melora’s Tide.effect:
The target gains regeneration 2 until the end of the encounter or until he or she is no longer bloodied.
Level 11: Regeneration 4.
Level 21: Regeneration 6.
Melora’s Tide.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter

Moradin’s Resolve.name: Moradin’s Resolve
Moradin’s Resolve.flavor: Moradin’s blessing puts the small on more equal footing with the large.
keywords: Moradin’s blessing puts the small on more equal footing with the large. Encounter Channel Divinity, Divine
Moradin’s Resolve.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against Large or larger creatures.
Moradin’s Resolve.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Pelor’s Radiance.name: Pelor’s Radiance
Pelor’s Radiance.flavor: When undead creatures abound, Pelor’s radiance shines to aid the faithful.
Pelor’s Radiance.range: Close burst 1 (3 at 11th level, 5 at 21st level)
Pelor’s Radiance.target: Each undead creature in the burst
Pelor’s Radiance.onHit:
1d10 + Wisdom modifier radiant damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 2d10 + Wisdom modifier radiant damage.
Level 21: 3d10 + Wisdom modifier radiant damage.
Pelor’s Radiance.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Raven Queen’s Blessing.name: Raven Queen’s Blessing
Raven Queen’s Blessing.flavor: The Raven Queen grants a boon to those who send the dead on their way.
Raven Queen’s Blessing.trigger: Your attack reduces an enemy within 10 squares of you to 0 hit points.
Raven Queen’s Blessing.target: You or an ally within 5 squares of the enemy
Raven Queen’s Blessing.effect: The target can spend a healing surge.
Raven Queen’s Blessing.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Sehanine’s Reversal.name: Sehanine’s Reversal
Sehanine’s Reversal.flavor: Sehanine’s blessing turns the powers of your enemies against them.
keywords: Sehanine’s blessing turns the powers of your enemies against them. Encounter Channel Divinity, Divine
Sehanine’s Reversal.trigger: You roll a natural 20 on a saving throw against an effect that a save can end.
Sehanine’s Reversal.effect: The target suffers the effect (save ends).
Sehanine’s Reversal.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Improved Immutability.name: Improved Immutability
Improved Immutability.flavor: Seemingly through your determination alone, your living construct body proves inviolate.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: You are subjected to an effect that a save can end  Effect: You end the triggering effect.
Improved Immutability.trigger: You are subjected to an effect that a save can end

Warforged Fortification.name: Warforged Fortification
Warforged Fortification.flavor: You’re so tough, sometimes even the worst hits don’t daunt you.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: A creature scores a critical hit against you  Effect: The triggering attack is instead a normal hit.
Warforged Fortification.trigger: A creature scores a critical hit against you
Warforged Fortification.effect: The triggering attack is instead a normal hit.

Body Shield (Garrote Expert).name: Body Shield (Garrote Expert)
Body Shield (Garrote Expert).flavor: Your choking hold with the garrote allows you to manipulate your adversary into harm’s way.
Body Shield (Garrote Expert).requirement: You must be wielding a garrote.
Body Shield (Garrote Expert).target: You are grabbing a creature, and you are the target of a melee or ranged attack made by an enemy other than the creature you are grabbing.
Body Shield (Garrote Expert).effect: The creature you are grabbing becomes the attack’s target.

Angharradh's Favor.name: Angharradh's Favor
Angharradh's Favor.flavor: Angharradh blesses those who show resolve and determination in the face of evil.
Angharradh's Favor.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Angharradh's Favor.trigger: You or an ally within range succeeds on a saving throw
Angharradh's Favor.effect: The target gains a +4 power bonus to saving throws until the end of his or her next turn.

Berronar’s Salve.name: Berronar’s Salve
Berronar’s Salve.flavor: Berronar’s merciful light shines down on a sorely wounded comrade, giving him or her the strength to continue.
Berronar’s Salve.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Berronar’s Salve.trigger: An ally drops to 0 hit points or fewer
Berronar’s Salve.effect: The target can immediately spend a healing surge.

Blessing of Silvanus.name: Blessing of Silvanus
Blessing of Silvanus.flavor: The deep vitality of the Oakfather wells up in your ally’s heart. For a short time, his or her wounds close on their own.
Blessing of Silvanus.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Blessing of Silvanus.trigger: An ally within 5 squares spends a healing surge
Blessing of Silvanus.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Blessing of Silvanus.effect: The target heals damage equal to your highest mental ability modifier.
Blessing of Silvanus.special: You must take the Blessing of Silvanus feat to use this power.

Chauntea's Blessing.name: Chauntea's Blessing
Chauntea's Blessing.flavor: Chauntea shields those who fight in her cause. With a single word of encouragement, your comrade rallies.
Chauntea's Blessing.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Chauntea's Blessing.trigger: An ally within 10 squares fails a saving throw
Chauntea's Blessing.effect: The target rerolls the failed saving throw with a +4 power bonus.

Eyes of Selûne.name: Eyes of Selûne
Eyes of Selûne.flavor:
Selûne watches over you. When your foes overwhelm you, she
grants a silver flicker of hope.
Eyes of Selûne.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Eyes of Selûne.onHit: You can immediately reroll the saving throw you just failed.

Fleetness of Mielikki.name: Fleetness of Mielikki
Fleetness of Mielikki.flavor: Mielikki blesses you with the quickness of the sacred white hart of the High Forest.
Fleetness of Mielikki.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Fleetness of Mielikki.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to speed and ignore difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

Glittergold's Gambit.name: Glittergold's Gambit
Glittergold's Gambit.flavor: Time and again, Garl Glittergold turned misfortune into unexpected success. He helps one of your allies to do the same.
Glittergold's Gambit.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Glittergold's Gambit.trigger: An ally in the burst makes an attack roll or skill check
Glittergold's Gambit.effect: The target immediately rerolls the attack roll or skill check he or she just made, but must keep the second result, even if it is worse.

Gond's Craft.name: Gond's Craft
Gond's Craft.flavor: Gond inspires you with an uncanny understanding of the device or weapon in your hand.
Gond's Craft.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Gond's Craft.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to any one attack roll made with a magic item power until the end of your next turn.

Ilmater's Martyrdom.name: Ilmater's Martyrdom
Ilmater's Martyrdom.flavor: You give of your own strength so that a wounded ally might endure.
Ilmater's Martyrdom.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Ilmater's Martyrdom.trigger: An ally in the burst is damaged by a critical hit
Ilmater's Martyrdom.target: The ally in the burst damaged by a critical hit
Ilmater's Martyrdom.effect: The target can immediately gain one healing surge and immediately spend it. You lose one healing surge.

Kelemvor's Judgment.name: Kelemvor's Judgment
Kelemvor's Judgment.flavor: The undead exist in defiance of Kelemvor’s will. You create a blast of brilliant light to burn these abominations into clean death.
Kelemvor's Judgment.range: Close blast 5 (8 at 11th level, 10 at 21st level)
Kelemvor's Judgment.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Kelemvor's Judgment.target: Each undead creature in the blast
Kelemvor's Judgment.onHit:
1d12 + Wisdom modifier radiant damage.
Increase damage to 2d12 + Wisdom modifier at 5th level, 3d12 + Wisdom modifier at 11th, 4d12 + Wisdom modifier at 15th, 5d12 + Wisdom modifier at 21st, and 6d12 + Wisdom modifier at 25th.

Oghma's Recall.name: Oghma's Recall
Oghma's Recall.flavor: You call upon Oghma for a flash of divine inspiration. Nothing can remain hidden from you for long.
Oghma's Recall.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Oghma's Recall.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +10 power bonus to all knowledge checks (made with the knowledge skills: Arcana, Dungeoneering, History, Nature, or Religion).

Power of Amaunator.name: Power of Amaunator
Power of Amaunator.flavor: Your radiant powers burn with the fury of the noontime sun.
Power of Amaunator.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Power of Amaunator.trigger: You hit an enemy with a power with the radiant keyword
Power of Amaunator.effect: Your power deals an extra 1d10 radiant damage to all targets hit by the power used.

Righteous Rage of Tempus.name: Righteous Rage of Tempus
Righteous Rage of Tempus.flavor: Tempus guides your arm and lends weight to your strike.
Righteous Rage of Tempus.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Righteous Rage of Tempus.effect: If you hit with the next weapon attack that you make before the end of your next turn and it isn't a critical hit, you roll the extra damage dice that you would roll if you scored a critical hit and deal the result as extra damage. If the attack is a critical hit, its extra damage is maximized.

Sheela Peryroyl's Gift.name: Sheela Peryroyl's Gift
Sheela Peryroyl's Gift.flavor: You invoke Sheela Peryroyl’s blessing to free yourself or an ally from some harmful effect.
Sheela Peryroyl's Gift.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Sheela Peryroyl's Gift.target: You or one ally in the burst
Sheela Peryroyl's Gift.effect: The target immediately rolls a saving throw.

Sune's Touch.name: Sune's Touch
Sune's Touch.flavor: Invoking Sune’s name, you help an ally against a challenging foe.
Sune's Touch.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Sune's Touch.effect: The target gains a +2 power bonus to his or her next attack roll or skill check made before the end of your next turn.

Torm's Justice.name: Torm's Justice
Torm's Justice.flavor: The sight of evil fills Torm with a cold, clear wrath. When you invoke his name, his just anger becomes yours.
Torm's Justice.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Torm's Justice.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against bloodied enemies until the end of your next turn.

Tymora's Coin.name: Tymora's Coin
Tymora's Coin.flavor:
Fortune begets fortune. Misfortune begets fortune. That is the
blessing of Tymora.
Tymora's Coin.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Tymora's Coin.trigger: You roll a natural 1 or natural 20 on an attack roll or saving throw
Tymora's Coin.effect: Once before the end of your next turn, you can roll d20 twice for an attack roll or a saving throw and use whichever d20 result you prefer.

Waukeen's Silver Tongue.name: Waukeen's Silver Tongue
Waukeen's Silver Tongue.flavor: You silently invoke Waukeen’s power to bestow eloquence and persuasiveness on your friend.
Waukeen's Silver Tongue.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Waukeen's Silver Tongue.effect: The target rerolls a Bluff, Diplomacy, or Intimidate check he just rolled, with a +5 power bonus. He uses the new result, even if it is lower than the original result.

Favor of Tymora.name: Favor of Tymora
Favor of Tymora.flavor: Tyche’s Fair-Haired Daughter protects those who take the greatest risks.
Favor of Tymora.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Favor of Tymora.effect: You gain a +1 bonus to all attack rolls and saving throws you make until the end of your next turn.

Dragonborn Zeal.name: Dragonborn Zeal
Dragonborn Zeal.sourceRef: Player's Handbook Races: Dragonborn, Dragon Magazine 365
Dragonborn Zeal.flavor: Your wounds sometimes make you relentless.
Dragonborn Zeal.trigger: Your hit points drop to 0 or fewer
Dragonborn Zeal.effect: You regain hit points equal to your healing surge value + your Charisma modifier. Add your Charisma modifier as a power bonus to your attack rolls and damage rolls against the enemy that reduced you to 0 hit points or fewer until the end of your next turn.

Shielding Familiar.name: Shielding Familiar
Shielding Familiar.flavor: Your familiar leaps to deflect an attack, sacrificing itself to save you.
Shielding Familiar.requirement: Your familiar must be in its passive state.
Shielding Familiar.trigger: You are hit by an attack
Shielding Familiar.effect: The triggering attack deals only half damage to you, and your familiar is destroyed.

Spellseer Familiar.name: Spellseer Familiar
Spellseer Familiar.flavor: Your familiar attracts your fruitlessly expended arcane energy, channeling power back to you to allow you to make another attempt.
Spellseer Familiar.requirement: Your familiar must be in its active state.
Spellseer Familiar.trigger: You miss a target with an arcane encounter attack power
Spellseer Familiar.effect: Reroll the attack roll and use the new result, even if it is lower.

Webs of Darkness.name: Webs of Darkness
Webs of Darkness.flavor: Inky tendrils of solidified darkness leap from your fingertip and bind your enemies.
keywords: Close blast 3  Target: Each creature in the blast  Attack: Intelligence + 4 vs. Reflex, Wisdom + 4 vs. Reflex, or Charisma + 4 vs. Reflex
Webs of Darkness.attack:
Intelligence + 4 vs. Reflex, Wisdom + 4 vs. Reflex, or Charisma + 4 vs. Reflex
Increase to +6 bonus at 21st level
Webs of Darkness.effect: Until the end of your next turn, the target is slowed and all creatures have concealment against the target.

Divine Rage.name: Divine Rage
Divine Rage.flavor: You welcome the wrath of the divine into your body, becoming a vessel of spiritual power.
Divine Rage.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Divine Rage.onHit: You push the target 1 square, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Binding Bola.name: Binding Bola
Binding Bola.flavor: The weights entwine the cords around your target, wrapping it so tightly so that it cannot maintain its momentum.
Binding Bola.requirement: You must be wielding a bola.
Binding Bola.onHit:
2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn. On a critical hit, the target is also knocked prone.
At 11th level, increase to 3[W] damage.
At 21st level, increase to 4[W] damage.

Bola Recovery.name: Bola Recovery
Bola Recovery.flavor: With the bola back in hand, you ready it for another precise throw.
keywords: Personal   Effect: Regain the use of the binding bola power.
Bola Recovery.effect: Regain the use of the binding bola power.

Felling Bola.name: Felling Bola
Felling Bola.flavor: Such is the force of your throw that you tangle up the enemy and knock it from its feet.
Felling Bola.requirement: You must be wielding a bola.
Felling Bola.onHit:
2[W] + Dexterity modifier + Strength modifier damage, and the target is knocked prone and cannot stand (save ends).
At 15th level, increase to 3[W] damage.
At 25th level, increase to 5[W] damage.
Felling Bola.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is knocked prone and cannot stand until the end of your next turn.

Net Sweep.name: Net Sweep
Net Sweep.flavor: You sweep your net around, smashing your foes and battering down their weapons.
Net Sweep.requirement: You must be wielding a net.
Net Sweep.onHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is slowed and takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
At 11th level, increase to 2[W] damage.
At 21st level, increase to 3[W] damage.

Net Shield.name: Net Shield
Net Shield.flavor: You spin the net in front of you to foil your enemies’ attacks.
Net Shield.requirement: You must be wielding a net.
Net Shield.effect: Until the start of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Reflex defense.

Net Trap.name: Net Trap
Net Trap.flavor: You fling the net so that it falls over your enemy. The more the foe  struggles, the tighter the net’s grasp becomes.
Net Trap.requirement: You must be wielding a net.
Net Trap.special: This attack has a reach of 5 regardless of the weapon’s actual reach.
Net Trap.onHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is grabbed (until escape). While the target is grabbed, it takes a –5 penalty to attack rolls and rolls made to escape the grab. While grabbing the target, you cannot make attacks with your net. You can sustain the grab as long as the target is within 5 squares of you.
At 15th level, increase to 2[W] damage.
At 25th level, increase to 3[W] damage.
Net Trap.aftereffect: The target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Net Trap.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn, but it is not  grabbed.

Whip Snare.name: Whip Snare
Whip Snare.flavor: With a deft flick of the wrist, you coil your whip around your foe’s limb, giving you some control of where that enemy goes—down or toward you.
Whip Snare.requirement: You must be wielding a whip.
Whip Snare.onHit:
2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and you can knock the target prone or pull the target 1 square.
At 11th level, increase to 3[W] damage.
At 21st level, increase to 4[W] damage.

Whip Crack.name: Whip Crack
Whip Crack.flavor: You snap your whip, warning your enemy not to move carelessly.
Whip Crack.requirement: You must be wielding a whip.
Whip Crack.effect: Until the start of your next turn, when an enemy within your reach takes an action that provokes opportunity attacks from adjacent enemies, it provokes an opportunity attack from you.

Entangling Whip.name: Entangling Whip
Entangling Whip.flavor: Your whip is like an extension of you, coiling around your enemy so you can drag that foe wherever you like.
Entangling Whip.requirement: You must be wielding a whip.
Entangling Whip.onHit:
2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, the target is grabbed (until escape) and knocked prone. The target takes a –5 penalty to escape the grab, and while you have the target grabbed you can pull it 1 square as a minor action. While grabbing the target, you cannot make attacks with the whip. You can sustain the grab as long as the target is within 2 squares of you.
At 15th level, increase to 3[W] damage.
At 25th level, increase to 4[W] damage.
Entangling Whip.onMiss: The target is grabbed (until escape) and knocked prone. While you have the target grabbed you can pull it 1 square as a minor action. While grabbing the target, you cannot make attacks with the whip. You can sustain the grab as long as the target is within 2 squares of you.

Radiant Touch.name: Radiant Touch
Radiant Touch.flavor: You transform your divine healing into radiant energy, damaging undead.
Radiant Touch.onHit: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. The target creature takes radiant damage equal to your healing surge value.
Radiant Touch.special: Use of this power counts toward your daily limit of uses of the lay on hands class feature.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.flavor: Vigor rushes through your body as you drain life energy from your victim
Blood Drain.target: One living creature you have grabbed
Blood Drain.attack: Strength +2 vs. Fortitude, Constitution +2 vs. Fortitude, or Dexterity +2 vs. Fortitude
Blood Drain.onHit:
1d4 + Constitution modifier damage, and you can spend a healing surge.
Level 11: +4 bonus and 2d4 + Constitution modifier damage.
Level 21: +6 bonus and 3d4 + Constitution modifier damage.
Blood Drain.special: When you select the Vampiric Heritage feat, you determine whether you use Strength, Constitution, or Dexterity to attack with this power.

Mist Form.name: Mist Form
Mist Form.flavor: Your form dissolves into an eerie, billowing mist.
Mist Form.effect: You become insubstantial and gain a fly speed of 8 (hover), but you cannot make any attacks. This lasts until the end of your next turn.

Bloodied Regeneration.name: Bloodied Regeneration
Bloodied Regeneration.flavor: Your wounds call to your immortal blood, which surges to repair your body.
Bloodied Regeneration.effect: You gain regeneration 5 until the end of the encounter or until you are no longer bloodied, whichever comes first.

Dominating Gaze.name: Dominating Gaze
Dominating Gaze.flavor: The authority in your piercing gaze demands utter submission.
Dominating Gaze.attack:
Intelligence +4 vs. Will, Wisdom +4 vs. Will, or Charisma +4 vs. Will
Level 21: +6 bonus.
Dominating Gaze.onHit: The target is dominated (save ends). Aftereffect: The target is dazed (save ends).
Dominating Gaze.special: When you select the Dominating Gaze feat, you determine whether you use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma to attack with this power.

Battle Awareness Feat.name: Battle Awareness Feat
Battle Awareness Feat.trigger: An enemy that is adjacent to you shifts or makes an attack that does not include you as a target.
Battle Awareness Feat.effect: You make a melee basic attack against the triggering enemy.

Bane's Tactics.name: Bane's Tactics
Bane's Tactics.flavor: The training and the strength of Bane allow you to strike with skill like no other.
Bane's Tactics.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Bane's Tactics.effect: You can use one of your 1st-level at-will melee attack powers that has a single target in place of your basic melee attack. You add your Strength bonus to the damage roll of this attack if you hit.
Bane's Tactics.special: You must take the Bane’s Tactics feat to use this power.

Chain Trip.name: Chain Trip
Chain Trip.flavor: You lash out with your chain and jerk your foe to the ground.
Chain Trip.requirement: You must be wielding a spiked chain.
Chain Trip.onHit:
1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, slide the target 2 squares and the target is knocked prone.
At 11th level, increase to 2[W] damage.
At 21st level, increase to 3[W] damage.

Chain Ward.name: Chain Ward
Chain Ward.flavor: You take a sidelong stance, whirling your chain above your head and watching your foes with sharp, opportunistic menace.
Chain Ward.requirement: You must be wielding a spiked chain.
Chain Ward.effect: You threaten all squares within your reach.

Spiked Shackles.name: Spiked Shackles
Spiked Shackles.flavor: With remarkable deftness, you wrap your foe in your chain, allowing you to squeeze the spike home and control your enemy’s movement.
Spiked Shackles.requirement: You must be wielding a spiked chain.
Spiked Shackles.onHit:
1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is grabbed until it escapes. You can sustain the grab as long as the target is within your reach, and the target takes a -2 penalty to escape attempts.
At 15th level, increase to 2[W] damage.
At 25th level, increase to 3[W] damage.
Spiked Shackles.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is grabbed until it escapes; you can sustain the grab as long as the target is within your reach.
Spiked Shackles.effect: Until the target is no longer grabbed, you can slide the target 1 square as a minor action. When you sustain the grab, the target takes 1[W] damage.

Stinging Shot.name: Stinging Shot
Stinging Shot.flavor: The needle lodges in a sensitive area, jolting your prey with pain.
Stinging Shot.requirement: You must be wielding a blowgun.
Stinging Shot.onHit:
2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
11th Level: Increase the damage to 3[W].
21st Level: Increase the damage to 4[W].
Stinging Shot.special: If you miss with this attack and you are hidden from your target, you remain hidden.

Uncanny Aim (Blowgun).name: Uncanny Aim (Blowgun)
Uncanny Aim (Blowgun).flavor: You breathe precisely, taking in your target and carefully lining up the needle’s trajectory.
keywords: Personal   Requirement: You must be wielding a blowgun.  Effect: Your next attack made before the end of your next turn gains a +2 bonus to the attack roll and deals +1[W] damage.
Uncanny Aim (Blowgun).requirement: You must be wielding a blowgun.
Uncanny Aim (Blowgun).effect: Your next attack made before the end of your next turn gains a +2 bonus to the attack roll and deals +1[W] damage.

Crippling Needle.name: Crippling Needle
Crippling Needle.flavor: Your needle lodges in a key pressure point, causing your target to stiffen and momentarily fail to act.
Crippling Needle.requirement: You must be wielding a blowgun.
Crippling Needle.onHit:
2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is stunned until the end of your next turn. Aftereffect: The target is dazed (save ends).
At 15th level, increase to 3[W] damage.
At 25th level, increase to 5[W] damage.
Crippling Needle.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).

Death's Messenger.name: Death's Messenger
Death's Messenger.flavor: You prey has an appointment with death, and your strike lets it know that fact.
Death's Messenger.special: In addition to the keyword above, this power is considered to have the same keywords and range as the at-will power you use with it.
Death's Messenger.target: One creature that is your prey
Death's Messenger.effect:
Use a melee or ranged at-will attack power on the target. If you hit, you deal 1[W] extra damage, or +1 die of damage if it is a nonweapon attack.
Level 13 Swap: 2[W] extra damage, or +2 dice of damage.
Level 23 Swap: 2[W] extra damage, or +2 dice of damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Brutal Instinct.name: Brutal Instinct
Brutal Instinct.flavor: With your defiant snarl, the advantage your foes had gained evaporates, giving you an opening.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: You are flanked, or your prey gains combat advantage against you  Effect: You do not grant combat advantage to those who triggered this power until the end of your next turn. If your prey is among those who triggered this power, you gain combat advantage against your prey until the end of your next turn.
Brutal Instinct.trigger: You are flanked, or your prey gains combat advantage against you
Brutal Instinct.effect: You do not grant combat advantage to those who triggered this power until the end of your next turn. If your prey is among those who triggered this power, you gain combat advantage against your prey until the end of your next turn.

Bravo's Finish.name: Bravo's Finish
Bravo's Finish.flavor: If your vicious assault doesn’t bring your prey down, it surely shows your prey what the near future holds.
Bravo's Finish.special: In addition to the keyword above, this power is considered to have the same keywords and range as the at-will power you use with it.
Bravo's Finish.target: One creature that is your prey
Bravo's Finish.effect:
Use an at-will attack power on the target. If the attack hits, you deal 2[W] extra damage, or +2 dice of damage if it is a nonweapon attack, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Level 19 Swap: 3[W] extra damage, or +3 dice of damage.
Level 29 Swap: 3[W] extra damage, or +3 dice of damage, and the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.

Sudden Retaliation.name: Sudden Retaliation
Sudden Retaliation.flavor: Faster than the eye can follow, you retaliate against those attacking you or your allies.
Sudden Retaliation.special: In addition to the keywords above, this power is considered to have the same keywords and range as the at-will power you use with it.
Sudden Retaliation.trigger: You or an ally is attacked by a creature
Sudden Retaliation.effect:
Use a melee or ranged at-will attack power on the target.
11th Level: The at-will power you use deals 1 extra die of damage.

Cutthroat's Scrutiny.name: Cutthroat's Scrutiny
Cutthroat's Scrutiny.flavor: Studying your opponent, you search for a weakness you can take advantage of.
keywords: Ranged sight  Target: One creature you can see  Effect: The target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn. During this time, you score a critical hit against the target on a natural roll of 19 or 20.
Cutthroat's Scrutiny.effect: The target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn. During this time, you score a critical hit against the target on a natural roll of 19 or 20.

Quick Kill.name: Quick Kill
Quick Kill.flavor: You slip from the shadows unseen, striking before the enemy knows what happened.
Quick Kill.special: In addition to the keyword above, this power is considered to have the same keywords and range as the at-will power you use with it.
Quick Kill.target: One creature that cannot sense your current location
Quick Kill.effect:
Use a melee or ranged at-will attack power on the target. If you hit, you deal 2 extra dice of damage.
15th Level: The at-will power you use deals 3 extra dice of damage.
25th Level: The at-will power you use deals 5 extra dice of damage.

Choking Grab.name: Choking Grab
Choking Grab.flavor: You slip your garrote over your enemy’s neck, and draw the cord tight.
Choking Grab.requirement: You must be wielding a garrote.
Choking Grab.target: One creature you have combat advantage against
Choking Grab.attack: Strength vs. Reflex or Dexterity vs. Reflex
Choking Grab.onHit:
2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn and grabbed.
11th Level: Increase the damage to 3[W].
21st Level: Increase the damage to 4[W].
Choking Grab.special: When you choose this power, choose whether you use Strength or Dexterity to make the attack.

Strangler's Hold.name: Strangler's Hold
Strangler's Hold.flavor: With expert skill, you loop the garrote around your victim and draw tight, closing off air and sending your enemy into unconsciousness.
Strangler's Hold.requirement: You must be wielding a garrote.
Strangler's Hold.target: One creature you have combat advantage against
Strangler's Hold.attack: Strength vs. Reflex or Dexterity vs. Reflex
Strangler's Hold.onHit:
2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends) and grabbed. Each turn you successfully maintain the grab with two hands, you deal the target damage equal to your Strength modifier.
15th Level: Increase the damage to 3[W].
25th Level: Increase the damage to 4[W].
Strangler's Hold.firstFailedSavingThrow: The target is stunned instead of dazed (save ends).
Strangler's Hold.secondFailedSavingThrow: The target is unconscious instead of stunned (save ends).
Strangler's Hold.special: When you choose this power, choose whether you use Strength or Dexterity to make the attack.

Improvised Poison.name: Improvised Poison
Improvised Poison.flavor: In your experience with toxins, you always have a little something on hand to make your attack venomous.
Improvised Poison.special: In addition to the keyword above, this power is considered to have the same keywords and range as the at-will power you use with it.
Improvised Poison.effect:
Use a melee or ranged at-will attack power. If you deal typed damage, you can change that damage type to poison. If you hit, you also deal ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends).
11th Level: If you hit, you also deal ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends).

Potent Poison.name: Potent Poison
Potent Poison.flavor: Your poisons have an insidious effectiveness.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: You miss with an attack that has the poison keyword or a poison effect.  Effect: Reroll the attack roll.
Potent Poison.trigger: You miss with an attack that has the poison keyword or a poison effect.

Progressive Toxin.name: Progressive Toxin
Progressive Toxin.flavor: You imbue your attack with a withering poison that diminishes your foe more the longer the poison acts.
Progressive Toxin.special: In addition to the keyword above, this power is considered to have the same keywords and range as the at-will power you use with it.
Progressive Toxin.effect: Use a melee or ranged at-will attack power on the target. If you deal typed damage, you can change that damage type to poison. If you hit, the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls and ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends both).
Progressive Toxin.firstFailedSavingThrow: The target is blinded instead of taking the -2 penalty (save ends).
Progressive Toxin.secondFailedSavingThrow:
The target is blinded and weakened instead of taking the –2 penalty (save ends both).
15th Level: Ongoing 15 poison damage (save ends).
25th Level: The at-will power you use deals 1 extra die of damage and ongoing 15 poison damage (save ends).
Progressive Toxin.onMiss: Half damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls and ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends both).

Aggressive Familiar.name: Aggressive Familiar
Aggressive Familiar.flavor: As you use an arcane power, your familiar explodes, damaging creatures you hit.
Aggressive Familiar.requirement: Your familiar must be in its active state.
Aggressive Familiar.effect: Your familiar is destroyed, and you gain a +5 power bonus to damage rolls against creatures that were adjacent to your familiar until the end of the current turn.

Astral Splendor.name: Astral Splendor
Astral Splendor.flavor: You take on an imperious aspect, and silvery light—that of your astral soul—shines from your eyes, mouth, and heart
Astral Splendor.effect: Until the stance ends, enemies take a -2 penalty to attack rolls made against you. You also shed bright light within 6 squares.
Astral Splendor.special: This stance ends when you become bloodied.

Anthem of Civilization.name: Anthem of Civilization
Anthem of Civilization.flavor: You inspire your allies to work in concert to turn the tide of battle.
Anthem of Civilization.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Anthem of Civilization.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you or an ally of your choice within 3 squares of you gains an additional +2 bonus to attack rolls against any enemy he or she flanks.

Creation Secret.name: Creation Secret
Creation Secret.flavor: Your prayer has a chance of extending the magic contained within an item.
Creation Secret.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Creation Secret.trigger: You use a magic item’s daily power
Creation Secret.effect: Roll a d20. If you roll 10 or higher, the use of the daily power is not expended.

Immediate Justice.name: Immediate Justice
Immediate Justice.flavor: You enforce balance with a flare of divine energy that lances your enemy.
Immediate Justice.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Immediate Justice.trigger: An enemy reduces your ally to 0 hit points or fewer or damages your unconscious ally
Immediate Justice.effect: The target takes radiant damage equal to 5 + one-half your level.

Ancestral Guidance.name: Ancestral Guidance
Ancestral Guidance.flavor: You call upon the ancestor spirits to guide your path.
Ancestral Guidance.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Ancestral Guidance.trigger: You make a skill check and dislike the result
Ancestral Guidance.effect: You gain a power bonus to the triggering roll equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Arawai's Abundance.name: Arawai's Abundance
Arawai's Abundance.flavor: Arawai shelters those who receive her blessings.
Arawai's Abundance.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Arawai's Abundance.effect: The target can spend a healing surge and gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Aureon's Instruction.name: Aureon's Instruction
Aureon's Instruction.flavor: You tap into Aureon’s vast wisdom to aid in your research and understanding.
Aureon's Instruction.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Aureon's Instruction.effect: Until the end of your next turn, when you make a knowledge or monster knowledge check you make two rolls and use the higher result.

Balinor’s Prey.name: Balinor’s Prey
Balinor’s Prey.flavor: The hunt is sweet, but the kill is far sweeter.
Balinor’s Prey.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Balinor’s Prey.effect:
The next melee or ranged attack that hits the target before the end of your next turn deals 1d6 extra damage.
Level 11: 2d6 extra damage.
Level 21: 3d6 extra damage.

Beacon of Dol Arrah.name: Beacon of Dol Arrah
Beacon of Dol Arrah.flavor: You let Dol Arrah’s light shine through.
Beacon of Dol Arrah.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Beacon of Dol Arrah.target: You and each ally in the burst
Beacon of Dol Arrah.effect:
Until the end of your next turn, each target can reroll any damage die roll of 1 or 2 when using a radiant attack power.
In addition, all squares within 5 squares of you are illuminated by bright light until the end of your next turn.

Boldrei’s Shelter.name: Boldrei’s Shelter
Boldrei’s Shelter.flavor: Boldrei protects those who advance her cause.
Boldrei’s Shelter.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Boldrei’s Shelter.targets: You and each ally in the burst
Boldrei’s Shelter.effect: Each target gains a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.

Kol Korran’s Boon.name: Kol Korran’s Boon
Kol Korran’s Boon.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Kol Korran’s Boon.trigger: A healing power restores an ally within 5 squares of you to his or her maximum hit points
Kol Korran’s Boon.target: The ally targeted by the triggering power
Kol Korran’s Boon.effect: The target gains temporary hit points equal to any hit points the triggering power restored in excess of the target’s maximum number of hit points.

Light Within.name: Light Within
Light Within.flavor: An arc of light shoots from your chest and brightens the ground.
Light Within.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Light Within.effect:
You spend a healing surge, and a zone of healing light appears in an unoccupied square within range. Until the end of your next turn, each ally that ends its turn within the zone regains hit points equal to your healing surge value.
In addition, all squares within 10 squares of the zone are illuminated by bright light until the end of your next turn.

Might of Dol Dorn.name: Might of Dol Dorn
Might of Dol Dorn.flavor: Draw from Dol Dorn’s strength, and you shall know victory.
Might of Dol Dorn.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Might of Dol Dorn.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack
Might of Dol Dorn.effect:
You gain 5 temporary hit points and a +5 power bonus to Athletics checks until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 10 temporary hit points.
Level 21: 15 temporary hit points.

Onatar's Gift.name: Onatar's Gift
Onatar's Gift.flavor: Onatar’s wisdom burns like a raging fire within you.
Onatar's Gift.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Onatar's Gift.trigger: You miss an enemy with a melee or ranged attack
Onatar's Gift.target: You or one ally in the burst
Onatar's Gift.effect:
Until the end of your next turn, the target gains a +2 bonus to Will and the target’s attacks deal 2 extra fire damage.
Level 11: 5 extra fire damage.
Level 21: 10 extra fire damage.

Shield of the Silver Flame.name: Shield of the Silver Flame
Shield of the Silver Flame.flavor: Those under the aegis of the Silver Flame have nothing to fear.
Shield of the Silver Flame.range: Close burst 3 (5 at 11th level, 7 at 21st level)
Shield of the Silver Flame.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Shield of the Silver Flame.target: You and each ally in the burst
Shield of the Silver Flame.effect: Each target can make a saving throw against a charm effect, a fear effect, or a psychic effect. A target that saves gains temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

Sovereign Justice.name: Sovereign Justice
Sovereign Justice.flavor: Through your allies’ exploits, you can attain victory even if you fall
Sovereign Justice.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Sovereign Justice.effect:
The target gains 5 temporary hit points.
Level 11: 10 temporary hit points.
Level 21: 15 temporary hit points.

Traveler’s Gift.name: Traveler’s Gift
Traveler’s Gift.flavor: The enigmatic god of change lifts your burdens.
Traveler’s Gift.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Traveler’s Gift.effect: Each target is no longer marked and can shift 1 square as a free action.

Undying’s Command.name: Undying’s Command
Undying’s Command.flavor: Undead pose little danger to those in service to the Undying Court.
Undying’s Command.range: Close blast 3 (5 at 11th level, 7 at 21st level)
Undying’s Command.target: One undead creature in the blast
Undying’s Command.onHit: The target is dominated until the end of your next turn.

Swordmage Warding.name: Swordmage Warding
keywords: Personal   Effect: While you are wielding a ligt blade or heavy blade you gain a +1 bonus to AC, if one hand is free you gain a +3 bonus to AC. If you go unconscious this feature ends.  Requirement: You must have the Blade Initiate feat to use this feature.
Swordmage Warding.effect: While you are wielding a ligt blade or heavy blade you gain a +1 bonus to AC, if one hand is free you gain a +3 bonus to AC. If you go unconscious this feature ends.
Swordmage Warding.requirement: You must have the Blade Initiate feat to use this feature.

Arcana Ward.name: Arcana Ward
Arcana Ward.flavor: Your god’s comprehension of arcane mysteries extends to shielding you from elemental forces.
Arcana Ward.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Arcana Ward.trigger: You are hit by an attack that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage to you
Arcana Ward.effect:
Until the end of your next turn, you gain resist 5 to a damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.
Level 11: Resist 10.
Level 21: Resist 15.

Cycle of Change.name: Cycle of Change
Cycle of Change.flavor: With your god’s help, you move the burden to where it can be borne with ease.
Cycle of Change.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Cycle of Change.effect: You transfer an effect that a save can end from the target to yourself or vice versa.

Darkness Consumes.name: Darkness Consumes
Darkness Consumes.flavor: You cause darkness to swirl around you and your allies for a moment.
Darkness Consumes.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Darkness Consumes.target: You and each ally in the burst
Darkness Consumes.effect: Each target gains concealment until the end of your next turn.

Death Knell.name: Death Knell
Death Knell.flavor: Death comes to all, and your god counts on you to hasten the moment.
Death Knell.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Death Knell.effect: If the target’s current hit points equal 5 + one-half your level or fewer, it drops to 0 hit points. Otherwise, you can use one of your other Channel Divinity powers during this encounter.

Path of Destruction (Channel Divinity).name: Path of Destruction (Channel Divinity)
Path of Destruction (Channel Divinity).flavor: A snarled prayer is enough to invoke the power of the Breaker, the Mangler, the Destroyer—your god.
Path of Destruction (Channel Divinity).channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Path of Destruction (Channel Divinity).trigger: You roll damage for a melee attack
Path of Destruction (Channel Divinity).effect: You reroll the damage and use either result.

Earth Hold.name: Earth Hold
Earth Hold.flavor: For a few moments, you give yourself up to your god’s hold. Those around you sense the divine presence as fearsome gravity.
Earth Hold.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Earth Hold.target: You and each enemy in the burst
Earth Hold.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you are immobilized, and the other targets are slowed.

Fate Rolls On.name: Fate Rolls On
Fate Rolls On.flavor: In your god’s presence, what was mere luck becomes destiny.
Fate Rolls On.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Fate Rolls On.trigger: A creature within 5 squares of you makes a saving throw
Fate Rolls On.effect: If the target failed the saving throw, it takes a -2 penalty to its next saving throw before the end of the encounter. If the target saved, it gains a +2 bonus to its next saving throw before the end of the encounter.

Path of Freedom.name: Path of Freedom
Path of Freedom.flavor: Through your prayer, you remind your friends that they are always truly free.
Path of Freedom.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Path of Freedom.effect: Each target can choose to make an escape attempt against a grab as a free action or to make a saving throw against an immobilizing, restraining, or slowing effect that a save can end.

Hope Remains.name: Hope Remains
Hope Remains.flavor: Those who rise again fight with renewed vigor.
Hope Remains.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Hope Remains.trigger: You or an ally within 10 squares of you regains consciousness after being reduced to 0 hit points or fewer
Hope Remains.target: The triggering character in the burst
Hope Remains.effect: The target gains a +2 power bonus to attack rolls, saving throws, and all defenses until the end of its next turn.

Sure Knowledge.name: Sure Knowledge
Sure Knowledge.flavor: Some portion of your god’s wisdom flows through you or your ally.
Sure Knowledge.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Sure Knowledge.trigger: You or an ally within 5 squares of you makes a knowledge check and doesn’t like the result
Sure Knowledge.effect: The target makes the knowledge check again and uses the new result.

Pulse of Life.name: Pulse of Life
Pulse of Life.flavor: In the mortal world, death cannot be entirely denied. But it can be postponed.
Pulse of Life.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Pulse of Life.trigger: A creature within 10 squares of you makes a death saving throw
Pulse of Life.effect: The target gains a +10 power bonus to the death saving throw.

Loving Sacrifice.name: Loving Sacrifice
Loving Sacrifice.flavor: The loving tie between you and your friend allows you to take some of the pain he or she would have suffered alone.
Loving Sacrifice.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Loving Sacrifice.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you takes damage
Loving Sacrifice.effect:
The damage against the target is reduced by 5, and you take 5 damage, which can’t be reduced in any way.
Level 11: The damage is reduced by 10, and you take 10.
Level 21: The damage is reduced by 15, and you take 15.

Imminent Luck.name: Imminent Luck
Imminent Luck.flavor: Your god gives you another chance at good fortune.
Imminent Luck.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Imminent Luck.trigger: You use a power that gives you a reroll, and the reroll is lower than the original roll
Imminent Luck.effect: You don’t expend the use of the power that gave you the reroll.

Screaming Madness.name: Screaming Madness
Screaming Madness.flavor: Ambushed by your dread god’s madness, your enemy lurches into lunacy
Screaming Madness.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Screaming Madness.effect: The next enemy you hit during this turn with a fear power hits itself with its melee basic attack the first time it makes an attack on its next turn. The enemy hits itself after its attack is resolved.

Moon Touched.name: Moon Touched
Moon Touched.flavor: You glow with the healing light of the moon. The light waxes and wanes for a time.
Moon Touched.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Moon Touched.target: You or one ally in the burst; target must be bloodied
Moon Touched.effect:
The target regains hit points equal to your Wisdom or Charisma modifier. At the start of each of your turns, roll a d8. If the roll is odd, the target gains temporary hit points equal to the roll, and if the target already has temporary hit points, the effect ends. If the roll is even, the target regains hit points equal to the roll, and the effect ends.
Level 11: Roll a d10 instead of a d8.
Level 21: Roll a d12 instead of a d8.

Original Poison.name: Original Poison
Original Poison.flavor: Your prayer empowers your venomous attacks.
Original Poison.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Original Poison.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against the target with poison powers.

Sure Protection.name: Sure Protection
Sure Protection.flavor: You ensure that a moment of respite is not interrupted.
Sure Protection.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Sure Protection.trigger: You or an ally within 5 squares of you uses his or her second wind
Sure Protection.effect: The target gains a +3 power bonus to all defenses until the start of his or her next turn.

Sea Surge.name: Sea Surge
Sea Surge.flavor: Your prayer calls forth a wave to carry you or your friend to safety.
Sea Surge.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Sea Surge.trigger: You or an ally within 10 squares of you is pulled, pushed, or slid
Sea Surge.target: The triggering character in the burst

Divine Excellence.name: Divine Excellence
Divine Excellence.flavor: Your prayer inspires excellence in yourself and your allies.
Divine Excellence.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Divine Excellence.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to the skill check. Until the end of your next turn, you and each ally within 10 squares of you gain a +2 power bonus to checks using the same skill.

Storm Sacrifice.name: Storm Sacrifice
Storm Sacrifice.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Storm Sacrifice.effect: You gain vulnerable 5 lightning and vulnerable 5 thunder. If the target has no lightning or thunder resistance, it gains vulnerable 5 lightning and vulnerable 5 thunder. If it has lightning or thunder resistance, it loses that resistance. These effects last until the end of your next turn.

Strength of the Gods.name: Strength of the Gods
Strength of the Gods.flavor: From your god, to your ally, and into the enemy: a passage of strength and impact.
Strength of the Gods.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Strength of the Gods.effect: The target gains a power bonus equal to your Strength modifier to its next damage roll before the end of your next turn.

Sudden Strife.name: Sudden Strife
Sudden Strife.flavor: You sow doubt in two enemies, causing them to question each other’s loyalty. Their combat acumen suffers as a result.
Sudden Strife.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Sudden Strife.target: Two enemies within 3 squares of each other
Sudden Strife.effect: Until the end of your next turn, the targets take a -4 penalty to attack rolls while they are within 3 squares of each other.

Solar Enemy.name: Solar Enemy
Solar Enemy.flavor: The divine sunlight playing across your enemies is a sign of the radiance to come.
Solar Enemy.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Solar Enemy.effect: Each target gains vulnerable 5 radiant, or its vulnerability to radiant damage increases by 5 until the end of your next turn.

Perfect Torment.name: Perfect Torment
Perfect Torment.flavor: Your prayer prolongs your enemies’ suffering.
Perfect Torment.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Perfect Torment.effect: Each target takes a -2 penalty to saving throws until the end of your next turn.

Trickster’s Fortune.name: Trickster’s Fortune
Trickster’s Fortune.flavor: You slyly twist your foe’s fate and try to turn its misfortune into your fortune.
Trickster’s Fortune.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Trickster’s Fortune.trigger: An enemy within 5 squares of you makes a saving throw
Trickster’s Fortune.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Trickster’s Fortune.effect: The target takes a -2 penalty to the saving throw. If the saving throw fails, you or an ally in the burst can make a saving throw.

Master of Tyranny.name: Master of Tyranny
Master of Tyranny.flavor: Your enemies’ weakness gives you strength.
Master of Tyranny.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Master of Tyranny.effect: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against bloodied creatures until the end of your next turn.

Undeath's Ally.name: Undeath's Ally
Undeath's Ally.flavor: At your touch, your friend’s life begins to slip away, but he or she gains some of the resilience of undeath.
Undeath's Ally.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Undeath's Ally.effect: The target loses a healing surge but gains temporary hit points equal to his or her healing surge value + one-half your level.

Small Vengeance.name: Small Vengeance
Small Vengeance.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Small Vengeance.trigger: You are bloodied by an enemy within 10 squares of you
Small Vengeance.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Small Vengeance.effect:
The target takes 1d8 damage.
Level 11: 2d8 damage.
Level 21: 3d8 damage.

Path of War.name: Path of War
Path of War.flavor: You encourage your friends to throw themselves into glorious battle.
Path of War.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Path of War.effect: Each target gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls and a -2 penalty to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Grasp of the WIld.name: Grasp of the WIld
Grasp of the WIld.flavor: You cause the environment to clutch at creatures in an area. Vines wrap around them, the earth softens under them, water churns about them—whatever is natural for the environs.
Grasp of the WIld.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Grasp of the WIld.effect: The area of the burst is difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

Path of Winter.name: Path of Winter
Path of Winter.flavor: At your prayer, you and your allies endure winter’s chill.
Path of Winter.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Path of Winter.target: You and each ally in the burst
Path of Winter.effect:
Each target gains resist 5 cold until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: Resist 10 cold.
Level 21: Resist 15 cold.

Divine Fate.name: Divine Fate
Divine Fate.flavor: A great power has plans for you and turns chance in your favor.
Divine Fate.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter
Divine Fate.trigger: You or an ally fails a skill or ability check, or a saving throw
Divine Fate.effect: The target rerolls the check or saving throw, and takes the higher result.

Enlarge Familiar.name: Enlarge Familiar
Enlarge Familiar.flavor: Suddenly, what had seemed a harmless pet rears up to threaten your enemy.
Enlarge Familiar.requirement: Your familiar must be in its active state.
Enlarge Familiar.effect: Until the start of your next turn, your familiar becomes a Small creature with hit points equal  to your healing surge value and can flank enemies. It cannot otherwise make attacks. When this effect ends, your familiar teleports into your space and enters passive mode.

Infused Familiar.name: Infused Familiar
Infused Familiar.flavor: You infuse your familiar with arcane energy, granting it the ability to render emergency aid.
Infused Familiar.requirement: It is your turn and your familiar must be in its active state.
Infused Familiar.effect: You use healing infusion, but your familiar is the origin square for the effect.

Dragonshard Shield.name: Dragonshard Shield
Dragonshard Shield.flavor: The embrace of the Dragon Between protects you both in time of need.
Dragonshard Shield.requirement: Your familiar must be in its active state.
Dragonshard Shield.trigger: An enemy adjacent to your familiar hits you or your familiar
Dragonshard Shield.effect: Reduce the damage the triggering enemy does to you by 10, and your familiar takes no damage from the attack. After the attack is resolved, you and your familiar shift your speed and have phasing during this move.

Siberys Unleashed.name: Siberys Unleashed
Siberys Unleashed.flavor: The glory of the Dragon Above shines through your familiar in time of need.
Siberys Unleashed.requirement: Your familiar must be in its active state.
Siberys Unleashed.effect:
Your familiar is destroyed. You conjure a wall of chill wind and brilliant light up to 4 squares high that lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall’s origin square is the square the familiar occupied. The wall costs 2 additional squares to enter, and enemies take a –2 penalty to attack rolls against targets inside or on the other side of the wall.
When an enemy starts its turn adjacent to or in the wall, you can slide that enemy up to 3 squares to a square also in or adjacent to the wall and the enemy is slowed until the
end of its turn.

Dragon's Rebuke.name: Dragon's Rebuke
Dragon's Rebuke.flavor: Your strike awakens the dragon within you, giving you the drive to punish you foe should it fail to give your god his proper due.
Dragon's Rebuke.onHit: 2[W] + your highest ability modifier damage. If the target makes an attack that does not include you as a target before the start of your next turn, you can push the target 2 squares as an immediate reaction.

Hand of Justice.name: Hand of Justice
Hand of Justice.flavor: A radiant draconic claw appears and punishes your enemy for attacking a friend.
Hand of Justice.trigger: An enemy within range that you can see hits an ally with an attack
Hand of Justice.onHit: 1d12 + your highest ability modifier damage, and the ally the triggering attack hit can spend a healing surge.

Righteous Judgment.name: Righteous Judgment
Righteous Judgment.flavor: You whisper a bitter prayer, condemning your enemy to Bahamut’s judgment.
Righteous Judgment.onHit: If the target moves before the end of your next turn, one ally within 5 squares of you may shift as an immediate reaction. If the target makes an attack before the end of your next turn, one ally within 5 squares of you gains a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls against the target until the end of your next turn.

Bahamut's Shield.name: Bahamut's Shield
Bahamut's Shield.flavor: You invoke the Platinum Dragon to shield yourself and others from harm.
Bahamut's Shield.onHit: 1[W] + your highest ability modifier damage, and the target takes a –2 penalty to its next attack roll before the end of your next turn.

Righteous Intolerance.name: Righteous Intolerance
Righteous Intolerance.flavor: Filled with righteous fury, you unleash divine wrath to penetrate your opponent’s defenses.
Righteous Intolerance.onHit: 2[W] + your highest ability modifier radiant damage.
Righteous Intolerance.effect: The enemy radiates Bahamut’s righteous fury (save ends). While the target radiates righteous fury, when an ally within 3 squares of the target takes damage from an attack, that ally gains temporary hit points equal to your highest ability modifier and you can shift up to your speed to a square adjacent to that ally.
Righteous Intolerance.aftereffect: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Righteous Savior.name: Righteous Savior
Righteous Savior.flavor: You rush to your endangered ally’s side to lend aid where it’s most needed.
Righteous Savior.trigger: An ally in range is hit by an attack
Righteous Savior.effect: Shift up to 5 squares to a square adjacent to the target. The target gains a +3 bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.

Shining Purpose.name: Shining Purpose
Shining Purpose.flavor: As you shrug off your injuries, your vision reveals a path to certain victory.
Shining Purpose.target: One ally you can see in the burst
Shining Purpose.effect: The target can spend a healing surge and then make a basic attack against the triggering enemy with a +2 power bonus on the attack roll as a free action. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 1d10 radiant damage.

Zealous Fury.name: Zealous Fury
Zealous Fury.flavor: When an enemy dishonors you by attacking an ally, you intercede to ensure your enemy does not make the same mistake twice.
Zealous Fury.trigger: An ally within range is hit by an attack
Zealous Fury.effect: The ally regains hit points as if it spent a healing surge, and you can teleport 10 squares to a square adjacent to the enemy that attacked the ally and mark that enemy (save ends).

Arcane Prodigy.name: Arcane Prodigy
keywords: Personal   Effect: You gain a +2 bonus to your next damage roll. The bonus increases to +3 at 11th level and +4 at 21st level.
Arcane Prodigy.effect: You gain a +2 bonus to your next damage roll. The bonus increases to +3 at 11th level and +4 at 21st level.

Pervasive Gloom.name: Pervasive Gloom
Pervasive Gloom.channelDivinity: You can use only one Channel Divinity power per encounter.
Pervasive Gloom.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack
Pervasive Gloom.effect: The burst creates a zone of shadows that lasts until the start of your next turn. Squares within the zone are heavily obscured.

Shadow Legacy.name: Shadow Legacy
Shadow Legacy.flavor: You extend the ancient covenant between your people and the Raven Queen to an ally in danger.
Shadow Legacy.channelDivinity: You can use only one Channel Divinity power per encounter.
Shadow Legacy.trigger: An attack bloodies an ally within range
Shadow Legacy.effect: The target either teleports 3 squares or gains insubstantial until the start of your next turn.

Evil Eye of the Vistani.name: Evil Eye of the Vistani
Evil Eye of the Vistani.flavor: You cast a baleful look upon your enemy, forcing it to cower before you.
Evil Eye of the Vistani.attack:
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma + 3 vs. Will
Level 11: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma + 6 vs. Will
Level 21: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma + 9 vs. Will
Evil Eye of the Vistani.onHit: Until the end of your next turn, the target grants combat advantage to you and cannot willingly move closer to you.

Severed Defenses.name: Severed Defenses
Severed Defenses.flavor: Your sly movements leave your opponent vulnerable to attacks.
Severed Defenses.onHit:
1[W] + Dexterity or Charisma modifier damage, and the target grants combat advantage to all attackers until the end of your next turn. You can make a Thievery check to pick the target’s pocket as a free action.
Level 13 Swap: 2[W] + Dexterity or Charisma modifier damage.
Level 23 Swap: 3[W] + Dexterity or Charisma modifier damage.
Severed Defenses.effect: You shift 1 square after the attack.

Thief's Getaway.name: Thief's Getaway
Thief's Getaway.flavor: You can wriggle out from a tight situation to make good your escape.
keywords: Personal   Effect: End a grab or the slowed, immobilized, or restrained condition. Then you shift 1 square.
Thief's Getaway.effect:
End a grab or the slowed, immobilized, or restrained condition. Then you shift 1 square.
Level 16 Swap: You shift half your speed.
Level 22 Swap: You shift your speed.

Guileful Swipe.name: Guileful Swipe
Guileful Swipe.flavor: You step inside your enemy’s reach to deliver a swift slash, step away to slash again, and step away once more to make off with your foe’s prized possession.
Guileful Swipe.onMiss: You shift to any square adjacent to the target.
Guileful Swipe.effect: You shift up to 4 squares to any square adjacent to the target, and during this shift can move through the target’s space. You can make a Thievery check as a free action to pick the target’s pockets. Make a secondary attack against the same target.
Guileful Swipe.secondaryeffect: You can shift a number of squares equal to your speed.

Pommel Strike.name: Pommel Strike
Pommel Strike.flavor: Your well-placed strike leaves your enemy reeling and vulnerable to your allies’ attacks.
Pommel Strike.target: One creature granting you combat advantage
Pommel Strike.onHit:
1[W] + Strength or Charisma modifier damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn. If the target takes damage from an attack while it is dazed from this attack, it also falls prone.
Level 13 Swap: Increase the damage to 2[W] + Strength or Charisma modifier damage.
Level 23 Swap: Increase the damage to 3[W] + Strength or Charisma modifier damage.

Thug's Menace.name: Thug's Menace
Thug's Menace.flavor: You exude such menace, your enemy thinks twice about attacking you.
Thug's Menace.trigger: You are hit or missed by an attack
Thug's Menace.effect: You gain combat advantage against the triggering attacker until the end of your next turn. You do not gain this bonus against attacks from creatures immune to fear.

Opportunistic Shove.name: Opportunistic Shove
Opportunistic Shove.flavor: Seeing an opening, you smash your enemy in a vulnerable area to send it sprawling.
Opportunistic Shove.target: One target granting you combat advantage
Opportunistic Shove.onHit:
1[W] + Strength or Charisma modifier damage.
Level 19 Swap: 3[W] + Strength or Charisma modifier damage.
Level 29 Swap: 4[W] + Strength or Charisma modifier damage.
Opportunistic Shove.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target provokes opportunity attacks from you whenever it stands up from prone. In addition, until the end of the encounter whenever you hit the target on your turn with a melee attack, you also knock the target prone.

Punitive Radiance.name: Punitive Radiance
Punitive Radiance.flavor: The punishment you levy on the unrighteous is visible from miles away.
Punitive Radiance.requirement: You must have the feat Light of Order in order to use this power.
Punitive Radiance.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack
Punitive Radiance.effect:
The target takes 1d6 extra radiant damage. Additionally, the target grants combat advantage and cannot benefit from invisibility until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 2d6 radiant damage.
Level 21: 3d6 radiant damage.

Warlock's Wrath.name: Warlock's Wrath
Warlock's Wrath.flavor: Arcane magic roars from you in a fiery storm, creating a vortex of energy around you.
Warlock's Wrath.effect: You fill your space and the squares around it with whirling fire. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a bonus to all defenses equal to your Charisma modifier, and each enemy that attacks you takes fire damage equal to half your level + your Intelligence modifier.

Paladin's Wrath.name: Paladin's Wrath
Paladin's Wrath.flavor: You stand against your foes, unleashing a howling battle cry that seems to howl from the depths of Hell.
Paladin's Wrath.effect: The target is subject to your divine sanction until the end of your next turn.

Diabolic Transformation.name: Diabolic Transformation
Diabolic Transformation.flavor: You roar with fury as the hellish blood that flows through your veins reveals its true power. In the blink of an eye, you transform into a brutish fiend.
Diabolic Transformation.effect: The attack deals 1d10 extra damage and the target takes a penalty to attack rolls against you equal to the higher of your Intelligence or Charisma modifier (save ends). The bonus damage increases to 2d10 at 11th level and 3d10 at 21st level.
Diabolic Transformation.special: Once during this encounter while you are in this form, you can use the black wrath of hell power.
Diabolic Transformation.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack.

Furious Demand.name: Furious Demand
Furious Demand.flavor: Your soul burns with anger, causing your foe to quail in fear at the expression on your face.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: You succeed on an Intimidate check or hit with an attack  Target: The creature you intimidated or hit  Effect: You gain a +2 bonus to all Intimidate checks until the end of the encounter. In addition, the target takes a penalty to attack rolls against you equal to your Charisma modifier (save ends).   Aftereffect: The target takes a penalty to attack rolls against you equal to your Charisma modifier until the end of its next turn.
Furious Demand.trigger: You succeed on an Intimidate check or hit with an attack
Furious Demand.target: The creature you intimidated or hit
Furious Demand.effect: You gain a +2 bonus to all Intimidate checks until the end of the encounter. In addition, the target takes a penalty to attack rolls against you equal to your Charisma modifier (save ends).
Furious Demand.aftereffect: The target takes a penalty to attack rolls against you equal to your Charisma modifier until the end of its next turn.

Wizard's Wrath.name: Wizard's Wrath
Wizard's Wrath.flavor: You funnel your anger into your magic, spawning a roaring vortex of raw power that batters your enemies, ruining their mundane and magical defenses.
Wizard's Wrath.effect: The burst becomes a zone of arcane energy that lasts until the end of your next turn. You gain combat advantage against targets in the zone, and they lose all immunities and resistances against your attacks.

In Death, Life.name: In Death, Life
In Death, Life.flavor: Your powers of death revitalize your body.
In Death, Life.trigger: You bloody an enemy or reduce an enemy to 0 hit points
In Death, Life.target: You or one ally in the burst
In Death, Life.effect: You spend a healing surge and the target gains hit points as if it spent the healing surge.

Amoth's Grace.name: Amoth's Grace
Amoth's Grace.flavor: Through Amoth’s power, you channel strength to your allies, allowing them to stand fast against evil.
Amoth's Grace.channelDivinity: You may only use one Channel Divinity power per encounter.
Amoth's Grace.trigger: You or an ally within range of you are either subject to a critical hit or bloodied by an attack
Amoth's Grace.effect: The triggering creature can spend a healing surge.
Amoth's Grace.special: You must take the Amoth’s Grace feat to use this power.

Destructive Power.name: Destructive Power
Destructive Power.flavor: By funneling greater power into your attack, you ensure its effect is not wasted.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: You roll a 1 on any damage die when you hit with an area or close attack power  Effect: You reroll any result of 1 or 2 on a damage die until the die roll is something other than 1 or 2.
Destructive Power.trigger: You roll a 1 on any damage die when you hit with an area or close attack power
Destructive Power.effect: You reroll any result of 1 or 2 on a damage die until the die roll is something other than 1 or 2.

Explosive Power.name: Explosive Power
Explosive Power.flavor: Your attack explodes outward in a silent wave of energy, pushing creatures away from your attack’s point of origin.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: You hit at least one creature with an area or close attack power  Effect: You push each creature in the burst or blast of the triggering attack power 5 squares away from the attack’s origin square. This forced move ends when a creature is no longer within the triggering attack’s blast or burst.
Explosive Power.trigger: You hit at least one creature with an area or close attack power
Explosive Power.effect: You push each creature in the burst or blast of the triggering attack power 5 squares away from the attack’s origin square. This forced move ends when a creature is no longer within the triggering attack’s blast or burst.

Forceful Power.name: Forceful Power
Forceful Power.flavor: You knock those struck by your attack from their feet.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: You hit at least one creature with an area attack power  Effect: You knock prone each creature you hit with the triggering power.
Forceful Power.trigger: You hit at least one creature with an area attack power
Forceful Power.effect: You knock prone each creature you hit with the triggering power.

Penetrating Power.name: Penetrating Power
Penetrating Power.flavor: You contain the attack’s energy in a magical shell so that you can punch through your enemy’s resistances.
keywords: Personal   Effect: The next ranged, area, or close attack you use before the end of your next turn ignores all resistances, including insubstantial.
Penetrating Power.effect: The next ranged, area, or close attack you use before the end of your next turn ignores all resistances, including insubstantial.

Seeking Power.name: Seeking Power
Seeking Power.flavor: Infusing your attack with greater power reduces the risk that intervening obstructions can foil your attack.
keywords: Personal   Effect: The next ranged attack roll you make before the end of your next turn ignores all concealment and cover.  Special: If the attack misses, you regain the use of this power.
Seeking Power.effect: The next ranged attack roll you make before the end of your next turn ignores all concealment and cover.
Seeking Power.special: If the attack misses, you regain the use of this power.

Oath of Urgency.name: Oath of Urgency
Oath of Urgency.flavor: You utter a prayer of need, calling upon your god to bring swift vengeance upon a new foe.
Oath of Urgency.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.
Oath of Urgency.effect: The current target of your oath of enmity is no longer the target of that power. You regain your oath of enmity power and use it as a free action immediately.

Drow Ecclesiastic.name: Drow Ecclesiastic
Drow Ecclesiastic.flavor: Lolth punishes those who escape her wiles.
Drow Ecclesiastic.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.
Drow Ecclesiastic.trigger: An enemy within range succeeds on a saving throw to end a condition
Drow Ecclesiastic.effect: The target takes ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends).

Spider Charmer.name: Spider Charmer
Spider Charmer.flavor: You draw upon Lolth’s ability to command spiders and drow.
Spider Charmer.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.
Spider Charmer.attack: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma vs. Will
Spider Charmer.onHit: The target spider or drow is dominated until the end of your next turn.
Spider Charmer.requirement: 11th level, drow, Channel Divinity class feature

Traveler's Celerity.name: Traveler's Celerity
Traveler's Celerity.flavor: The Traveler blesses those in a bind with an easy escape and fleet feet. Those who fail to make use of this gift suffer for it.
Traveler's Celerity.channelDivinity: You can only use one Channel Divinity power per encounter.
Traveler's Celerity.effect: The target gains a +2 bonus to speed until the end of your next turn, and it can make a saving throw against each slowed, immobilized, or restrained effect. If the target saves, the condition ends even if a save doesn’t normally end the condition.

Elemental Legacy.name: Elemental Legacy
Elemental Legacy.flavor: You allow the hated elemental energy in your soul to swell forth and scour your foes.
Elemental Legacy.trigger: You hit an enemy with an attack
Elemental Legacy.effect:
Your attack deals 3 extra acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage to the enemy.
Level 11: This attack deals 6 extra damage.
Level 21: This attack deals 9 extra damage.

Bane's Tyrannical Transference.name: Bane's Tyrannical Transference
Bane's Tyrannical Transference.flavor: You call on Bane to transfer a hindrance to another—someone better suited to endure its consequences.
Bane's Tyrannical Transference.channelDivinity: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.
Bane's Tyrannical Transference.trigger: You or an ally within range becomes dazed, immobilized, stunned, or slowed
Bane's Tyrannical Transference.effect: You transfer that effect to you or to another ally within the burst.

Progress of Erathis.name: Progress of Erathis
Progress of Erathis.flavor: With this quick prayer to Erathis, you call your allies to move forward though the wilderness.
Progress of Erathis.channelDivinity: You can use only one Channel Divinity power per encounter.
Progress of Erathis.target: You and each ally in the burst
Progress of Erathis.effect: The target ignores difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

Mantle of Misfortune.name: Mantle of Misfortune
Mantle of Misfortune.flavor: While the enemy remains near you, its feet slip, it drops things, and nothing goes right.
keywords: Personal   Effect: Until the end of your next turn, enemies take a -2 penalty to attack rolls while within 5 squares of you and each time an enemy within 5 squares of you misses with an attack you can slide the target 1 square as a free action.
Mantle of Misfortune.effect: Until the end of your next turn, enemies take a -2 penalty to attack rolls while within 5 squares of you and each time an enemy within 5 squares of you misses with an attack you can slide the target 1 square as a free action.

Winter's Shroud.name: Winter's Shroud
