Winter's Shroud.flavor: When the enemy’s attack falls, snow swirls around you to whisk you to safety.
Winter's Shroud.trigger: An enemy damages you with an attack
Winter's Shroud.effect: You teleport 3 squares and gain concealment until the start of your next turn.

Balm of the Cultivator.name: Balm of the Cultivator
Balm of the Cultivator.flavor: Your enemy’s attack releases healing energy within you, which you use to aid your friend.
Balm of the Cultivator.trigger: An enemy damages you with an attack
Balm of the Cultivator.effect: The target can spend a healing surge.

Argent Falcon.name: Argent Falcon
Argent Falcon.flavor: Your familiar transforms into a silver falcon, and shines with pure moonlight.
Argent Falcon.effect: Your familiar sheds bright light in its square and each square within 3 squares of it until the end of your next turn. Until the end of your next turn, enemies grant combat advantage while within 3 squares of your familiar.

Bog Hunter's Poison.name: Bog Hunter's Poison
Bog Hunter's Poison.flavor: You carefully apply to a weapon a poison that you extracted from local flora and fauna during a rest.
Bog Hunter's Poison.effect:
The next attack made with the target weapon that hits before the end of the encounter deals an extra ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends). Each Failed Saving Throw: The ongoing damage increases by 5 (to a maximum of ongoing 20 poison damage).
Level 11: Ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends). Each Failed Saving Throw: The ongoing damage increases by 5 (to a maximum of ongoing 25 poison damage).
Level 21: Ongoing 15 poison damage (save ends). Each Failed Saving Throw: The ongoing damage increases by 5 (to a maximum of ongoing 30 poison damage).

Bogtangle Dart.name: Bogtangle Dart
Bogtangle Dart.flavor: An enemy struck by your dart feels a spreading numbness as the venom does its work.
Bogtangle Dart.requirement: You must be wielding a blowgun and use it for this attack.
Bogtangle Dart.onHit:
1[W] damage plus your highest ability modifier poison damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn. If the target is already slowed, it becomes immobilized until the end of your next turn instead.
Level 21: 2[W] damage.

Deft Diver.name: Deft Diver
Deft Diver.flavor: You move through the water like a fish and can make the most cumbersome weapons deadly underwater.
keywords: Personal   Effect: You swim a number of squares equal to your speed. Until the end of your next turn, you take no penalties to attack rolls during aquatic combat for using a weapon other than a spear or crossbow.
Deft Diver.effect: You swim a number of squares equal to your speed. Until the end of your next turn, you take no penalties to attack rolls during aquatic combat for using a weapon other than a spear or crossbow.

Net Snare.name: Net Snare
Net Snare.flavor: You catch an enemy in your net and maneuver it into position.
Net Snare.requirement: You must be wielding a net and use it for this attack.
Net Snare.onHit:
1[W] damage, and the target is grabbed. The grab automatically ends at the start of your next turn. If you used this power as a melee attack, you slide the target 1 square. If you used this power as a ranged attack, you pull the target 1 square.
Level 21: 2[W] damage.

Bathed in the Light.name: Bathed in the Light
Bathed in the Light.flavor: You draw upon the power Pelor to seal your wounds, rather than causing more harm.
Bathed in the Light.trigger: An enemy would deal fire or radiant damage to you
Bathed in the Light.effect: Reduce the triggering damage to 0. You regain a number of hit points equal to the fire or radiant damage you would have taken before reducing the damage.

Sunspray Dance.name: Sunspray Dance
Sunspray Dance.flavor: You spin your weapon through the air, catching the sun’s radiance to send it slashing through your foe.
Sunspray Dance.onHit:
1[W] + your highest ability modifier radiant damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
Level 21: 2[W] + your highest ability modifier damage.

Unrelenting Mountain.name: Unrelenting Mountain
Unrelenting Mountain.flavor: You stand tough like the eternal fortress lands of Wolfstone, refusing to bend or break in the face of an enemy.
Unrelenting Mountain.effect: You enter the unrelenting mountain stance. Until the stance ends, you reduce the distance an enemy can push, pull, or slide you by 2 squares. While you are bloodied and in this stance, you also gain resist 5 all and cannot be knocked prone.

Wolfstone Frenzy.name: Wolfstone Frenzy
Wolfstone Frenzy.flavor: Your anger tears free from your throat in a blood-curdling howl as you bring your weapon down in a savage chop.
Wolfstone Frenzy.onHit:
1[W] + your highest ability modifier, and you push each enemy adjacent to you 1 square.
Level 21: 2[W] + your highest ability modifier damage.

Memory is a Weapon.name: Memory is a Weapon
Memory is a Weapon.flavor: When you miss an enemy with an attack, you remember your error and call upon this memory to strike true.
keywords: Personal   Trigger: You miss with a melee or ranged attack roll.  Effect: You gain a +3 power bonus to attack rolls against the triggering attack roll’s target until the end of your next turn.
Memory is a Weapon.trigger: You miss with a melee or ranged attack roll.
Memory is a Weapon.effect: You gain a +3 power bonus to attack rolls against the triggering attack roll’s target until the end of your next turn.

Gaze of Ruin.name: Gaze of Ruin
Gaze of Ruin.flavor: Your gaze causes foodstuffs to become inedible, a wood door to rot, armor to grow brittle, or a weapon to rust.
keywords: Ranged 10  Target: One object  Effect: The target gains vulnerability to all damage equal to one-half your level + your Intelligence modifier until the end of your next turn. If the target is a weapon, attacks with it take a penalty to damage rolls equal your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1) until the end of your next turn. If the target is armor, a creature wearing it takes a -2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn.
Gaze of Ruin.effect: The target gains vulnerability to all damage equal to one-half your level + your Intelligence modifier until the end of your next turn. If the target is a weapon, attacks with it take a penalty to damage rolls equal your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1) until the end of your next turn. If the target is armor, a creature wearing it takes a -2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn.

Black Blade of Despair.name: Black Blade of Despair
Black Blade of Despair.flavor: Your weapon blurs, becoming a thing of smoke and darkness. Where it falls, death surely follows.
Black Blade of Despair.requirement: You must be wielding a heavy blade or light blade.
Black Blade of Despair.onHit: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier or Charisma modifier damage plus 1d6 cold and necrotic damage, and you become insubstantial until the end of your next turn.

Shade Stride.name: Shade Stride
Shade Stride.flavor: You melt into the gloom and reappear some distance away from where you were.
Shade Stride.effect: You teleport 10 squares to any square containing dim light or darkness.

Gathering of Shadows.name: Gathering of Shadows
Gathering of Shadows.flavor: Darkness crawls across the ground, piercing your foes with shadow duplicates of your weapon and leaving them reeling in pain before the darkness wraps around you.
Gathering of Shadows.onHit: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier or Charisma modifier cold and necrotic damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Gathering of Shadows.effect: You become invisible until the end of your next turn and can shift 1 square. Until the end of the encounter, dim light grants you total concealment instead of normal concealment.
Gathering of Shadows.level19Swap: 2[W] + Dexterity or Charisma modifier cold and necrotic damage.
Gathering of Shadows.level29Swap: 3[W] + Dexterity or Charisma modifier cold and necrotic damage.

Drag Behind.name: Drag Behind
Drag Behind.flavor: Using your cahulaks, you entangle your enemy and drag the creature behind you as you move across the battlefield.
Drag Behind.requirement: You must be wielding a cahulaks.
Drag Behind.effect: You move your speed, pulling the target with you. You do not provoke an opportunity attack from the target for this movement.

Tripping Cahulaks.name: Tripping Cahulaks
Tripping Cahulaks.flavor: The weighted end of your cahulaks catches your opponent, pulling the enemy closer while you prepare for another attack if it tries to escape.
Tripping Cahulaks.requirement: The power Tripping Cahulaks must be active in order to use this power.
Tripping Cahulaks.onHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you pull the target 1 square. Until the start of your next turn, you can use the Tripping Cahulaks Attack power against the target.
Level 17: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Level 27: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Tripping Cahulaks.trigger: The target willingly enters a square that is not adjacent to you while you are wielding a cahulaks.
Tripping Cahulaks.secondaryOnHit: 1[W] damage, and you knock the target prone.

Binding Cahulaks.name: Binding Cahulaks
Binding Cahulaks.flavor: You spin your cahulaks and hurl it at a distant foe. The weighted cords wrap around the enemy and cause it to fall.
Binding Cahulaks.requirement: You must be wielding a cahulaks.
Binding Cahulaks.onHit:
1[W] + 1[W] (off-hand end) + Strength modifier damage, and you knock the target prone. The target is immobilized (save ends).
Level 25: 2[W] + 2[W] (off-hand end) + Strength modifier damage.

Warding Talon.name: Warding Talon
Warding Talon.flavor: Enemies trying to find an opening in your defenses face a swift slash from your dragon paw.
Warding Talon.effect:
You assume the warding talon stance. Until the stance ends, while you are wielding a dragon paw, any enemy that hits you with an opportunity attack takes 1[W] damage (off-hand end).
Level 21: 2[W] damage (off-hand end).

Dragon Rampage.name: Dragon Rampage
Dragon Rampage.flavor: The enemy might have you surrounded, but a few quick strikes from your dragon paw deter foes from remaining close.
Dragon Rampage.requirement: You must be wielding a dragon paw.
Dragon Rampage.onHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Level 17: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Level 27: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Dragon Rampage.secondaryTarget: One or two creatures other than the primary target
Dragon Rampage.secondaryOnHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, or 2[W] + Strength modifier if you target only one creature with the secondary attack.

Furious Dragon Assault.name: Furious Dragon Assault
Furious Dragon Assault.flavor: You lash out your dragon paw and deliver a swift, punishing strike against a single enemy before turning to other foes.
Furious Dragon Assault.requirement: You must be wielding a dragon paw.
Furious Dragon Assault.onHit:
3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you slide the target 1 square.
Level 25: 4[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Furious Dragon Assault.effect: Make a secondary attack that is a close burst 1.
Furious Dragon Assault.secondaryTarget: Each enemy you can see in the burst other than the primary target
Furious Dragon Assault.secondaryOnHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you push the secondary target 1 square and knock it prone.
Level 25: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage.

Gouge Press.name: Gouge Press
Gouge Press.flavor: When an enemy staggers under your gouge assault, you adroitly follow.
Gouge Press.trigger: You hit an enemy with a gouge.
Gouge Press.effect: You shift 3 squares to a square adjacent to the enemy.

Gouge Sweep.name: Gouge Sweep
Gouge Sweep.flavor: You swing your gouge in an arc, thrusting it at a couple foes to knock them aside.
Gouge Sweep.requirement: You must be wielding a gouge.
Gouge Sweep.onHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you slide the target 1 square and knock it prone.
Level 17: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you slide the target 2 squares and knock it prone.
Level 27: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you slide the target 3 squares and knock it prone.

Gouge Pin.name: Gouge Pin
Gouge Pin.flavor: With driving force, you push your enemy down and pin it to the ground with your gouge.
Gouge Pin.requirement: You must be wielding a gouge.
Gouge Pin.onHit:
3[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Level 25: 4[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Gouge Pin.effect: You knock the target prone and grab it. Until the grab ends, the target cannot stand up. When you attack any creature other than the target, the grab ends. When you push, pull, or slide the target while it is grabbed by you, the grab does not end as a result of the forced movement, and you can shift your speed to a square adjacent to the target.

Gythka Parry.name: Gythka Parry
Gythka Parry.flavor: After delivering a solid blow, you move to a defensive position and adjust your grip to place your gythka between yourself and your enemy.
Gythka Parry.trigger: You hit an enemy with a gythka.
Gythka Parry.effect: You shift half your speed and gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Reflex against the triggering enemy until the end of your next turn.

Gythka Claw Swoop.name: Gythka Claw Swoop
Gythka Claw Swoop.flavor: Using the off-hand end of your gythka as a distraction, you swipe at your enemy and then dart around to deliver a more decisive blow with the main end.
Gythka Claw Swoop.requirement: You must be wielding a gythka.
Gythka Claw Swoop.onHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your turn.
Gythka Claw Swoop.effect: Make a secondary attack against the target.
Gythka Claw Swoop.secondaryOnHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Level 17: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage (main end).
Level 27: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage (main end).
Gythka Claw Swoop.secondaryeffect: Before or after the secondary attack, you shift half your speed.

Gythka Arc Slam.name: Gythka Arc Slam
Gythka Arc Slam.flavor: You punch your gythka into your enemy, causing it to double over in pain. You then heft the weapon up, ready to bring it crashing down if your foe tries to stand.
Gythka Arc Slam.requirement: You must be wielding a gythka.
Gythka Arc Slam.onHit:
2[W] + Strength modifier damage. You slide the target 3 squares to a square adjacent to you and knock it prone. Until the end of your next turn, you can use the Gythka Arc Attack power.
Level 25: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.
Gythka Arc Slam.trigger: The target stands up while you are wielding a gythka.
Gythka Arc Slam.secondaryOnHit:
1[W] damage, and the target cannot stand up (save ends).
Level 25: 2[W] damage.

Lotulis Parry.name: Lotulis Parry
Lotulis Parry.flavor: Spinning your lotulis, you ward off an incoming attack.
Lotulis Parry.trigger: You are hit by a melee or a ranged attack while wielding a lotulis.
Lotulis Parry.effect: You gain a bonus to AC and Reflex against the triggering attack equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Lotulis Flurry.name: Lotulis Flurry
Lotulis Flurry.flavor: You strike an enemy with your lotulis, bashing the foe aside or else using the distraction to move into position to attack another foe.
Lotulis Flurry.requirement: You must be wielding a lotulis.
Lotulis Flurry.attack: Strength or Dexterity vs. AC (main end)
Lotulis Flurry.onHit:
2[W] + Strength or Dexterity modifier damage, and you slide the primary target 1 square. You can forgo the secondary attack to instead slide the primary target 5 squares.
Level 17: 3[W] + Strength or Dexterity modifier damage.
Level 27: 4[W] + Strength or Dexterity modifier damage.
Lotulis Flurry.effect: After the primary attack, you shift 1 square and make a secondary attack (if desired).
Lotulis Flurry.secondaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target
Lotulis Flurry.secondaryOnHit: 2[W] + Strength or Dexterity modifier damage, and you slide the secondary target 1 square.

Whirling Lotulis.name: Whirling Lotulis
Whirling Lotulis.flavor: You attack with your lotulis, giving you room to dash between your opponents.
Whirling Lotulis.requirement: You must be wielding a lotulis.
Whirling Lotulis.target: Each enemy you can see in the burst
Whirling Lotulis.onHit:
2[W] + Strength or Dexterity modifier damage.
Level 25: 3[W] + Strength or Dexterity modifier damage.
Whirling Lotulis.effect: After the attack, you shift half your speed. During this movement, you can move through enemies’ spaces.

Elan Resilience.name: Elan Resilience
Elan Resilience.flavor: Psionic energy flares around you, limiting the effect of an attack.
Elan Resilience.trigger: You take damage from an attack
Elan Resilience.effect:
Reduce the triggering attack’s damage by your Intelligence modifier.
Level 11: 3 + Intelligence modifier.
Level 21: 6 + Intelligence modifier.

Unbalanced Mind.name: Unbalanced Mind
Unbalanced Mind.flavor: Your connection to the Far Realm unleashes psychic pain in response to attack.
Unbalanced Mind.trigger: You take damage from an attack
Unbalanced Mind.effect: Until the end of your next turn, any creature that enters a square adjacent to you or ends its turn there takes 5 psychic damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Dawn the Black Sun.name: Dawn the Black Sun
Dawn the Black Sun.flavor: Shar's vengeance washes through you, exacting a terrible price from those who defy you.
Dawn the Black Sun.trigger: An enemy within 2 squares of you damages you with an attack.
Dawn the Black Sun.onHit: The target is blinded until the start of your next turn. If the target takes any damage while blinded by this attack, the blindness ends and you can slide the target up to 3 squares as a free action.
Dawn the Black Sun.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Demonic Aggression.name: Demonic Aggression
Demonic Aggression.flavor: Once your ire is raised, your demonic heritage rages out of control.
Demonic Aggression.trigger: An enemy within 3 squares of you damages you with an attack.
Demonic Aggression.effect: Teleport to any unoccupied square adjacent to the triggering enemy. You gain combat advantage against that enemy until the end of your next turn.

Shade Step.name: Shade Step
Shade Step.flavor: Shadows swirl up around you and speed you to safety.
Shade Step.effect: You teleport up to 5 squares. If you are within 10 squares of a square of darkness or that is dimly lit, you can instead teleport to that square.

Zadatl Grab.name: Zadatl Grab
Zadatl Grab.flavor: You lunge forward with your zadatl, twisting it as your strike lands so that your foe is caught in the sharp pincers and held well away from you.
Zadatl Grab.requirement: You must use this power with a zadatl.
Zadatl Grab.target: One creature of size Large or smaller.
Zadatl Grab.onHit:
2[W] + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage, and you grab the target with your zadatl. You can end the grab as a free action. If the target escapes the grab, you can make a secondary attack against it as an opportunity action.
Level 17: 3[W] + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage.
Level 27: 4[W] + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage
Zadatl Grab.secondaryOnHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage.
Level 27: 2[W] + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage.

Zadatl Expert Stance.name: Zadatl Expert Stance
Zadatl Expert Stance.flavor: You watch for the perfect opening to strike with your zadatl.
Zadatl Expert Stance.effect: You assume the zadatl expert stance. Until the stance ends, when you hit a creature with an at-will weapon attack power using a zadatl, you can use a free action to grab the target with your zadatl. You can end the grab as a free action.

Zadatl Control.name: Zadatl Control
Zadatl Control.flavor: After snagging your foe with your zadatl, you can push it around and trip it if it tries to escape.
Zadatl Control.requirement: You must use this power with a zadatl.
Zadatl Control.onHit:
3[W] + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage, and you grab the target with your zadatl. While you have the target grabbed in this way, the target takes a -2 penalty to escape the grab. In addition, until the grab ends, whenever you move, you can slide the target with you an equal number of squares but it must remain within the zadatl's reach. If the target escapes the grab, you can make a secondary attack against it as an opportunity action.
Level 25: 4[W] + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage.
Zadatl Control.secondaryOnHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier damage, and the target falls prone.

Fury of the Elements.name: Fury of the Elements
Fury of the Elements.flavor: You channel elemental power and unleash its fury against your foes.
Fury of the Elements.trigger: You are hit by an enemy attack that deals cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.
Fury of the Elements.effect: You take half damage from the triggering attack. Until the end of your next turn, your next attack deals 1d6 extra damage of the type or types dealt by the triggering attack.

Battle Trample.name: Battle Trample
Battle Trample.flavor: You incite your mount to stamp, rear, and kick unpredictably. Any foe remaining too close to you takes damage and is driven back a step or two.
keywords: Melee 1  Target: Your mount that you are riding and that has a trample power.  Effect: The target gains an aura 1 that lasts until the start of your next turn. When any enemy that is Medium or smaller ends its turn in the aura, that enemy takes 3 damage, and the target can push the enemy 1 square.
Battle Trample.target: Your mount that you are riding and that has a trample power.
Battle Trample.effect: The target gains an aura 1 that lasts until the start of your next turn. When any enemy that is Medium or smaller ends its turn in the aura, that enemy takes 3 damage, and the target can push the enemy 1 square.

Command Undead.name: Command Undead
Command Undead.flavor: You compel an undead creature to become your slave for a time.
Command Undead.target: One undead creature in the burst
Command Undead.onHit: You slide the target up to a number of squares equal to 3 + your primary ability modifier. The target then becomes immobilized until the end of your next turn. Any creature that ends its turn adjacent to the target takes 5 damage. At the end of the move, the target makes a basic attack as a free action against a creature of your choice.
Command Undead.onMiss: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Vecna's Final Command.name: Vecna's Final Command
Vecna's Final Command.sourceRef: Dragon Magazine 395, The Book of Vile Darkness
Vecna's Final Command.flavor: You hold death back to allow the dying one final attack.
Vecna's Final Command.trigger: A creature within 5 squares of you drops below 1 hit point.
Vecna's Final Command.target: The triggering creature in the burst
Vecna's Final Command.effect: The target makes a basic attack as a free action against a creature you choose.
Vecna's Final Command.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Nowhere to Hide.name: Nowhere to Hide
Nowhere to Hide.flavor: As the sound of your prayer spreads around you, your foes are revealed.
Nowhere to Hide.target: Each hidden or invisible enemy in the burst whose Will is equal to or lower than 12 + your level
Nowhere to Hide.effect: Each target becomes visible to you, and grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.
Nowhere to Hide.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Asmodeus’s Fiery Command.name: Asmodeus’s Fiery Command
Asmodeus’s Fiery Command.flavor: Asmodeus rewards those who please him and destroys those who fail.
Asmodeus’s Fiery Command.effect:
If the target hits an enemy with an attack before the end of the target’s next turn, the target gains 5 temporary hit points. Otherwise, the target and each creature adjacent to him or her take 3 fire damage at the end of his or her next turn.
Level 11: 10 temporary hit points or 5 fire damage.
Level 21: 15 temporary hit points or 10 fire damage.
Asmodeus’s Fiery Command.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Bane’s Instructive Stratagem.name: Bane’s Instructive Stratagem
Bane’s Instructive Stratagem.flavor: Bane shows the clear path to victory.
Bane’s Instructive Stratagem.effect:
The target gains a +1 power bonus to attack rolls until the end of your next turn. If the target’s next attack hits an enemy, that attack deals 3 extra damage to the enemy. If the attack misses, the target grants combat advantage until the end of his or her next turn.
Level 11: 6 extra damage.
Level 21: 9 extra damage.
Bane’s Instructive Stratagem.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Gruumsh’s Battle Fury.name: Gruumsh’s Battle Fury
Gruumsh’s Battle Fury.flavor: An ally’s violent success earns Gruumsh’s reward. You channel divine power to inspire an ally to greater acts of violence.
Gruumsh’s Battle Fury.trigger: An ally within 3 squares of you drops a creature below 1 hit point.
Gruumsh’s Battle Fury.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Gruumsh’s Battle Fury.effect: The target can charge or make a basic attack as a free action. In addition, the target grants combat advantage until the end of his or her next turn.
Gruumsh’s Battle Fury.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Lolth’s Cruel Sacrifice.name: Lolth’s Cruel Sacrifice
Lolth’s Cruel Sacrifice.flavor: You channel the goddess’s blessing to save you from danger at an ally’s expense.
Lolth’s Cruel Sacrifice.trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.
Lolth’s Cruel Sacrifice.effect: You and the target teleport, swapping positions, and the target is hit by the attack, instead of you. You or one ally (other than the target) adjacent to you can then spend a healing surge.
Lolth’s Cruel Sacrifice.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Tiamat’s Bitter Vengeance.name: Tiamat’s Bitter Vengeance
Tiamat’s Bitter Vengeance.flavor: You can channel Tiamat’s wrath, gaining the revenge she demands above all else.
Tiamat’s Bitter Vengeance.trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.
Tiamat’s Bitter Vengeance.effect:
You shift up to 3 squares. Until the end of your next turn, each time you or an ally hits the triggering enemy, it takes 2 extra damage.
Level 11: 4 extra damage.
Level 21: 6 extra damage.
Tiamat’s Bitter Vengeance.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Torog’s Binding Chains.name: Torog’s Binding Chains
Torog’s Binding Chains.flavor: You channel your god’s presence into your attack that causes shimmering chains to wrap around your foe.
Torog’s Binding Chains.trigger: You hit an adjacent enemy with a melee attack.
Torog’s Binding Chains.effect:
The target is immobilized (save ends). The target can end the effect by taking 5 damage as a free action.
Level 11: 10 damage.
Level 21: 15 damage.
Torog’s Binding Chains.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Zehir’s Dark Blessing.name: Zehir’s Dark Blessing
Zehir’s Dark Blessing.flavor: An ally’s attack becomes an offering to Zehir. Darkness cloaks your companion, granting him or her sudden vigor.
Zehir’s Dark Blessing.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you drops a creature granting combat advantage to him or her below 1 hit point.
Zehir’s Dark Blessing.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Zehir’s Dark Blessing.effect:
The target gains 5 temporary hit points. The target also gains partial concealment until the end of his or her next turn.
Level 11: 10 temporary hit points.
Level 21: 15 temporary hit points.
Zehir’s Dark Blessing.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Elemental Conduit.name: Elemental Conduit
Elemental Conduit.flavor: Chaos from your elemental companion twists space so that the two of you can swap positions.
Elemental Conduit.target: Your active elemental companion in the burst
Elemental Conduit.effect: You teleport yourself and the target, swapping positions.

Elemental Vengeance.name: Elemental Vengeance
Elemental Vengeance.flavor: A burst of scintillating colors erupts from your destroyed companion, distracting your enemies and calling the companion back to you.
Elemental Vengeance.range: Close burst 1 centered on the space your companion last occupied
Elemental Vengeance.trigger: Your active elemental companion is destroyed.
Elemental Vengeance.effect: Each target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn. In addition, your elemental companion returns to you in passive mode.

Great Mother's Step.name: Great Mother's Step
Great Mother's Step.flavor: Chauntea’s lessons of unity guide your allies along their way.
Great Mother's Step.target: You and one ally in burst
Great Mother's Step.effect: Each target can shift up to 5 squares. If this movement can start and end adjacent to a plant that is Large or larger, the target can teleport instead of shifting.
Great Mother's Step.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Forest Father's Grasp.name: Forest Father's Grasp
Forest Father's Grasp.flavor: Spectral vines envelop your target in a spiritual echo of primeval forests.
Forest Father's Grasp.trigger: You hit a creature with a divine attack power or a primal attack power.
Forest Father's Grasp.effect: The creature you hit falls prone, and it is slowed (save ends).
Forest Father's Grasp.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.

Nerull's Binding.name: Nerull's Binding
Nerull's Binding.flavor: The shade of a dead enemy provides you with a dark veil of temporary protection.
Nerull's Binding.trigger: You drop an enemy below 1 hit point, or an enemy adjacent to you drops below 1 hit point.
Nerull's Binding.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of your next turn. You have partial concealment against enemies in the aura. Any creature that makes a melee attack against you or ends its turn in the aura takes necrotic damage equal to your Wisdom modifier. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.
Nerull's Binding.special: You can use only one channel divinity power per encounter.
